Experience Finance Project Manager Google June 2015  – Present (3 months) Mountain View, CA Senior Financial Analyst, Technical Infrastructure Google April 2014  –  May 2015  (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, CA -Provide financial planning and long-term investment decision support to Technical Infrastructure leadership 
 
-Partner with Advertising and YouTube Product Area Leads and their respective resource managers and financial leads in providing infrastructure decision-making support on an on-going basis 
 
-Review month-end close/forecasting for Technical Infrastructure including reporting and analysis of actuals and forecast 
 
-Act as liaison between the core Finance team and Data Center Operations, assisting with issues relating to developing ROI and Total Cost of Ownership models. 
 
-Partner with engineering teams to ensure finance's interests are taken into account with all application development. Manage team's system's roadmap by prioritizing asks and defining financial requirements. Senior Financial Systems Project Manager Google May 2012  –  April 2014  (2 years) Mountain View, CA -Project manager for new product introductions, feature upgrades, and entity launches for Google's display advertising products. 
 
-Responsibilities include defining and documenting order to cash finance requirements for global projects while balancing different stakeholder demands, negotiating requirements, and facilitating project execution. 
 
-Project managed the internationalization of display products into the Russia and Argentina markets, enabling incremental revenue of ~$40M a year. 
 
-Implemented new process for prioritizing and managing the Oracle Accounts Receivable roadmap. 
 
-Program Manager for initiative to move $1B+ of Advertising revenue in 9 emerging market countries to a new billing & payments system. Work included scoping and analysis of tax and accounting requirements, vendor integration with payment and invoicing service providers, and communicating status and issues to senior finance management. Enterprise Infrastructure Cost Transparency & Benchmarking Morgan Stanley May 2010  –  May 2012  (2 years 1 month) Greater New York City Area -Created Product Catalog that categorized ~$2B of Enterprise Infrastructure spend per year into ~100 products. 
 
-Partnered with Product Managers to develop cost allocation models for each product that incentived the right behavior. 
 
-Performed business reviews with the firm's business units to report on IT cost allocations and advice on levers for reducing their consumption of IT resources. 
 
-Liaison between Corporate Finance, Business Units and IT teams for technology cost transparency & allocations. 
 
-Managed a team of developers to create QlikView dashboards on IT cost allocations that provided an integrated TCO view of IT costs by service, department, GL line item and project. 
 
-Benchmarked firm's IT solutions to 6 other banks and identified top opportunity areas for cost reductions. 
 
-Analyzed performance metrics over time to highlight trends and the impact of changes to underlying cost drivers in order to help managers address the key drivers in escalating IT costs. Business Planning Manager Hewlett-Packard September 2008  –  May 2010  (1 year 9 months) -Created a balanced scorecard metric (100 metrics) and goal measuring system for a 1,000-person division which successfully measured each group’s performance towards goals and identified areas for improvement. 
 
-Led the Portfolio Execution & Portfolio Planning Reporting. Provided analysis and recommendations based on reports, which were used by managers throughout the division to increase management decision making.  
 
-Hosted reporting forums with business planners for each group to review, enhance, and create new reports. 
 
-Developed an innovative work planning system, subsequently institutionalized company-wide, which streamlined workflow and communication between IT teams. Project Manager / Business Analyst Chrysler LLC May 2006  –  September 2008  (2 years 5 months) Auburn Hills, MI -Reduced capital spending by 75%, totaling $8 million, by creating new policies for maintaining corporate PC's and creating a new PC Service model and PC lifecycle policy. 
 
-Project managed a multimillion dollar project to outsource and right-size all of Chrysler's North American printer, scanner, fax and copier service and equipment with estimated savings of $2 million yearly.  
 
-Defined common global business processes and systems between Chrysler and Mercedes-Benz for parts & service division. 
 
-Created and implemented new tooling request system that reduced the time to market accessories by 75%. Experience HR Project Manager (Tech) Google May 2015  – Present (4 months) Mountain View Lead, special projects for Tech promotion process  
 
* Streamline authorization and publication of exemplary promotion applications to optimize promotion decisions. 
 HR Coordinator Manager (Tech) Google July 2014  –  May 2015  (11 months) Mountain View, CA Manager, team of 9 HR Coordinators who provided support to 60 Tech HR Business Partners 
 
* Eliminated own role by proposing and gaining VP approval to decentralize the team based on deep dive analysis of the position and team direction. 
* Improved team performance through coaching, load-balancing, upskilling (SQL trainings, process documentation), team onsite planning and facilitation, and process improvement.  
* Team project highlights included: HRBP website revamp; 43% efficiency gain in conducting voluntary exit interviews; complete process overhaul and administration of semiannual Technical Infrastructure Manager Survey taken by ~7k Googlers.  
 
Program Manager, oncall bonus processing 
 
* Processed ~$5M in global oncall bonus payments for Tech employees with 99.2% accuracy. 
* Designed tool with Analytics team to calculate bonuses and streamline data submission.  
* Partnered cross-functionally to improve the global process by standardizing templates, automating inputs, identifying new policies, and determining deadlines for submissions, saving 0.25 headcount.  HR Operations Analyst Google February 2014  –  July 2014  (6 months) Mountain View, CA Program Manager, compensation recovery (six month assignment) 
 
* Processed all compensation recovery requests over 5 months with zero errors.  
* Defined requirements for automating end-to-end process, saving 0.75 headcount.  
* Improved Googler experience: saved 15min per clawback by eliminating signing and scanning; reduced turnaround time from 2+ weeks to same-day. 
* Streamlined process for other stakeholders: ensured proper record-keeping, removed Business Intelligence team involvement, and reduced Payroll questions.  
* Partnered with Legal to consolidate 5 US payroll deduction forms into one, updated all templates, and confirmed Docs as a binding contract mechanism (with improved security over PDF attachments).  HR Staffing Specialist & Project Manager Google March 2013  –  February 2014  (1 year) Mountain View, CA Project lead, Staffing Specialist hiring 
 
* Designed process, strategized resource planning, and led project team of 7 to generate 47 offers (46% onsite-to-packet rate). Other recruiting teams have emulated this process. 
* Partnered cross-functionally to create structured interview guide, and facilitated training sessions to calibrate interviewers on the role and interview process. 
* Conducted 250+ phone interviews to measure Google's four attributes, including General Cognitive Ability screening.  
* Led 73/75 candidate debrief sessions (97%) to calibrate initial interviewers, then created debrief request form in lieu of auto-scheduling, saving 85 employee hours over 5 months. 
* As a side project, mentored and built community for the 30+ newly-hired Staffing Specialists in Mountain View, Austin, and NYC from Q4 2013 - Q1 2014. Held 100+ meetings (monthly group, bi-weekly 1:1s) and hosted social events. Lo Startup Weekend è una grande opportunità per tutti coloro che hanno delle idee e non sanno come fare per tradurle in realtà, ma anche per startup già esistenti che sono alla ricerca di persone per ampliare il proprio team e vogliono incontrare investitori e partner. 
E’ un grande laboratorio che riunisce persone con formazione ed esperienze diverse ma unite nella condivisione di un sogno, quello di concretizzare un progetto. 
Lo Startup Weekend è un evento della durata di 54 ore (dal venerdì pomeriggio alla domenica sera) che riunisce sviluppatori, designer, esperti di business e marketing, product manager e in generale tutti coloro che nutrono interesse per il mondo del web, del mobile, dell’IT e dell’innovazione in genere. 
Per questo motivo, lo Startup Weekend, non si limita a far incontrare idee e sviluppatori ma anche le realtà dell’imprenditoria già avviata, sempre pronta a dare feedback e consigli, e degli investitori sempre alla ricerca di progetti interessanti. 
 
Come volontario svolgo il ruolo di Mentor per l'edizione catanese e di organizzatore per quella di Palermo. I am the founder and also the leader of this group. As leader, I recruit speakers and handle meeting logistics.  
 
In June of 2012 I've represented the group at the World Summit held in Mountain View, San Francisco. Founder, Mentor Sementor May 2012  – Present (3 years 4 months) Palermo Area, Italy Sementor è un’iniziativa volta ad incentivare il trasferimento a giovani talenti (semen) di conoscenza e competenza da parte di affermati esperti (mentor) allo scopo di dare vita ad idee progettuali dirompenti. L’idea partorita all’interno di neu[nòi] (www.neunoi.it), il nuovo coworking nel centro storico di Palermo, mira a portare in breve tempo una moltitudine di idee progettuali ad uno stadio di concreta realizzabilità attraverso una serie di percorsi formativi tematici. 
 
- La prima mentorship gratuita in programma (2012) è stata dedicata a chi intende sviluppare idee nel sempre mutevole universo del WEB. 
- Il secondo ciclo, "Saracinesche creative" (2012), è nato con l’obiettivo di ridare vita al tessuto urbano stimolando la riapertura delle tante saracinesche chiuse che caratterizzano le vie della città. 
- La terza mentorship (2013) è destinata a chiunque sia intenzionato ad avviare un’attività turistica legata al territorio siciliano. 
- Il quarto ciclo (2014) è dedicato alle attività legate alla terra: se volete fare impresa nei settori agricoltura, orticoltura, uso, fruizione, valorizzazione di spazi verdi in genere. http://www.uetitalia.it/palermo/ Ambassador #WCAP - Working Capital Accelerator Catania Telecom Italia May 2013  – Present (2 years 4 months) Catania Area, Italy Working Capital è il programma di Telecom Italia che dal 2009 aiuta l’innovazione, le idee e il talento a trasformarsi in impresa, supportando in modo diretto la nascita e lo sviluppo delle startup. 
 
Working Capital ha creato tre acceleratori a Milano, Roma e Catania, in cui fare crescere idee ambiziose. Gli spazi sono anche punti di contatto e di ascolto per tutti coloro che sono interessati ai temi dell’innovazione. L’obiettivo è mettere a disposizione delle community territoriali spazi di networking e formativi sui temi di maggiore interesse in collaborazione con Università, incubatori e partner locali. 
 
All’interno di ogni spazio le startup selezionate seguiranno un programma di accelerazione di tre mesi, a Luglio, Settembre, Ottobre, con mentor specifici per ogni area. I mentor daranno supporto per affinare l’idea, il prodotto e il modello di business. I team delle startup avranno la possibilità confrontarsi con venture capitalist, startupper, imprenditori di successo. E affinare la propria idea. Cannizzaro Math , 54/60 1983  – 1988 Honors & Awards 1° Classificato al "Geo Codelab" - Google Developer Day 2008, Milano Google October 2008 Nell'ottobre del 2008 Google organizzò il Google Developer Day a Milano. Il programma prevedeva durante la mattinata la realizzazione di alcuni Codelab della durata di un paio di ore per applicare le API di Google in pratica. Circa 120 sviluppatori italiani si ritrovarono in una stanza, per creare la migliore applicazione Geo possibile, partendo da una traccia rilasciata dagli ingegneri di Google che supervisionavo il contest. Conclusi il mio lavoro e lo inviai via email incrociando le dita.  
Dopo l'intesa giornata di lavori e convegni, nel pomeriggio arrivò il momento della premiazione. Terzo Classificato XXX, Secondo Classificato YYY, Primo Classificato Francesco Passantino e venni invitato a salire sul palco.
